title: 107_s1058
content: The Act may be cited as the "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" and includes an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding a credit for biodiesel used as fuel. The "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a biodiesel fuels credit based on the biodiesel mixture credit for the taxable year. The biodiesel mixture credit is calculated by multiplying the biodiesel mixture rate by the number of gallons of qualified biodiesel mixture blends used by the taxpayer. The biodiesel mixture rate varies based on the blend percentage: 0.5-2.0% for B-1, 2.0-20% for B-2, and 20% for B-20. These blends are defined by the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. The term 'qualified biodiesel mixture' refers to a blend of diesel and biodiesel, with specific percentages defining B-1, B-2, and B-20 blends. The 'applicable amount' is calculated based on the biodiesel percentage in the blend. The term 'qualified biodiesel mixture' refers to a blend of diesel and biodiesel, with specific percentages defining B-1, B-2, and B-20 blends. The denominator is 1 percent. Qualified biodiesel mixture is sold or used by the taxpayer producing it for fuel purposes in their trade or business. The biodiesel mixture credit is only applicable if sold or used in the taxpayer's trade or business for the taxable year. No credit is allowed for casual off-farm production. The credit amount may be reduced to account for any benefit from the exemption of excise tax on biodiesel. The biodiesel credit is reduced to consider benefits from other tax exemptions. Biodiesel is defined as esters from various vegetable oils for diesel engines. Registration requirements apply. The biodiesel is derived from various vegetable oils and must meet EPA registration requirements. If biodiesel used in qualified biodiesel mixtures is separated or used for purposes other than fuel, a tax is imposed based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons. All applicable laws and penalties apply. If biodiesel used in qualified biodiesel mixtures is separated or used for purposes other than fuel, a tax is imposed based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons. Applicable laws and penalties apply, and taxpayers can elect to not apply this section for any taxable year. Regulations similar to those for estates and trusts apply for pass-thru situations. Taxpayers can elect to not apply the biodiesel fuels credit for any taxable year. The credit is treated as part of the general business credit. The biodiesel fuels credit is amended and added to various sections of the tax code, including section 38(b) and section 39(d). The credit cannot be carried back before January 1, 2003. The biodiesel fuels credit is amended in section 196(c) by adding a new paragraph (11) for the credit determined under section 40A. Additionally, the table of sections is amended to include the new item related to the biodiesel fuels credit. The amendments made by section 40A regarding biodiesel fuel will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001. Additionally, there is a reduction in motor fuel excise taxes on biodiesel mixtures. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures under Section 4081 is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate. Diesel fuel used in producing biodiesel mixtures also qualifies for a reduced tax rate. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate, with the reduction amount determined based on the percentage of biodiesel in the mixture. Definitions in this subsection align with those in section 40A, and certain rules apply similarly. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate, as defined in section 40A. Conforming amendments are made to sections 4041 and 6427. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate defined in section 40A. Section 6427 is amended to include provisions for biodiesel mixtures, with an effective date of January 1, 2002. SEC. 4. HIGHWAY TRUST FUND HELD HARMLESS. Transfers will be made from the Commodity Credit Corporation to the Highway Trust Fund to offset reductions in receipts due to amendments made by this Act. Estimates will be made by the Secretary of the Treasury and adjustments will be made for any errors in the estimates.
